glsa.title: libvpx: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: Timothy B. Terriberry discovered that libvpx contains an integer overflow vulnerability in the processing of video streams that may allow user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: libvpx is the VP8 codec SDK used to encode and decode video streams, typically within a WebM format media file.

description.p: libvpx is vulnerable to an integer overflow vulnerability when processing crafted VP8 video streams.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted media file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All libvpx users should upgrade to the latest stable version:
Packages which depend on this library may need to be recompiled. Tools such as revdep-rebuild may assist in identifying some of these packages.
